sources.full: Deities of the World of Claybough

deity.name: Ambro Eurix
deity.title: The deity of retribution
deity.symbol: Katana, Wakizashi and Tanto on Stand; or just a Wakizashi

customProperties.Garb/Portfolio: Katana, Wakizashi and Tanto on Stand; or just a Wakizashi
customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Retribution, Common Sense, Wisdom, Zeal, Honesty, Truth
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: {@class figther|phb}, {@class monk|phb}, Order of the Demon Slayers, judges, constables, vigilantes

entries: The deity of retribution, Ambro Eurix (pronounced AHM-bro YUR-ihks) also called St. Ambro or sometimes Ambrosius, usually appears as a black-cloaked, ninja-like figure wielding a wakizashi. Like several of his brothers, he has white hair.
Ambro is affiliated with the color green, and usually wears a green shirt, scarf or other accessory.
His worshippers wear green robes.

St. Ambro exacts revenge and punishment on those who harm the innocent. He may have once been a mortal man who was deified after taking his war against demons into Hell itself (as his worshippers claim), but if so it was long ago and from an unknown branch of humanity.

deity.name: Ásabragr Staan-tage
deity.title: The god of the Dwarves

customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Dwarves, Creation, Smithing, Storms, Thunder, War.
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Dwarves, Metalworkers, {@class barbarian|phb|Barbarians}, {@class fighter|phb|Fighters}, {@class paladin|phb|Paladins}, {@class ranger|phb|Rangers}, Farmers and other Commoners

entries: The god of the Dwarves, Ásabragr (pronounced AH-suh-brahgr), usually appears as a stern-faced male dwarf with a powerful build.
His upper body is particularly robust, with a barrel chest, wide shoulders and arms corded with big muscles.
He has flowing black hair and a beard to match, and he always wears full plate armor.
He carries a shield and a warhammer.
Ásabragr forged the first Dwarves out of metal and gems and brought them to life with lightning.

deity.name: Eclypse Callisto
deity.title: God of Strength, Athletics, Sports, Brawling, Courage

customProperties.Domains: {@class cleric|phb|Luck|Luck Domain}, {@class cleric|phb|Liberation|Liberation Domain}, {@class cleric|psa|Strength (PSA)|Strength Domain (PSA)}

deity.name: Elishar
deity.title: The 'Father of the Gods' holds knowledge and magic above all things.
deity.symbol: A silver piece transforming into a crescent moon

customProperties.Garb/Portfolio: A silver piece transforming into a crescent moon

entries: Elishar (pronounced EL-ih-shar), the 'Father of the Gods' holds knowledge and magic above all things.
He has gained enough power to witness all that transpired on all planes, and this has both fueled his divinity and drove him irreparably mad.
He is a god of magic, torn between destroying the world with one hand and saving it with the other.
This dual-edged nature of magic is cherished by his followers and is epitomized in his apotheosis.

Elishar usually appears as a frightening male human emanating great energy. One side of him is youthful and dominating, almost glowing with power while healing the sick and protecting the innocent, while his other half is charred and crackling with leaking magic that unleashes destruction.
Areas of unpredictable magic are thought to occur when Elishar passes too close to the Material Plane, while dead magic zones (where magic does not function) are seen as a sign of his disfavor.
The Father of the Gods does not visit his worshipers in dreams to show favor or dislike, a fact that they often mention with pride.
They see the divine attention of other gods as patronizing or coddling, and are glad that Elishar does not stoop to such common practices.

deity.name: Ithil'Quessir
deity.title: Goddess of Protection, Fertility, Music, Dance, Moon, Fate, Motherhood

customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Protection, Fertility, Music, Dance, Moon, Fate, Motherhood
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Travelers, Astronomers, Gamblers, Mothers, Lovers, Musicians, Artists

entries: Ithil'Quessir (pronounced ih-THIL-kwes-ear) is one of the Elven Gods often described as a beautiful elven woman, with butterfly wings containing all the beauty of a clear night sky.
She is often depicted as having dark hair, silvery eyes, and a coy but distant smile, wearing diaphanous gowns and sometimes accompanied by swarms of butterflies.

deity.name: Midnight Ria
deity.title: Goddess of Tyranny War, Discord, Massacres, Conflict

customProperties.Domains: {@class cleric|twitter|Darkness (Twitter)|Darkness Domain (Twitter)}, {@class cleric|phb|Death|Death Domain}, {@class cleric|phb|Destruction|Destruction Domain}, {@class cleric|phb|Trickery|Trickery Domain}

deity.name: Noi Tai Darastrix
deity.title: God of Evil Dragons, Conquest, Greed, Kobolds, Wetlands, Wrath, Natural Disaster
deity.symbol: Three claw marks upon a 6-sided gem

customProperties.Garb/Portfolio: Three claw marks upon a 6-sided gem
customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Evil Dragons, Conquest, Greed, Kobolds, Wetlands, Wrath, Natural Disasters
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Evil Dragons, Reptilian Creatures, Orcs, Gnolls, Savage Tribes

entries: Noi Tai Darastrix is a great crystalline onyx dragon who rules the Nine Hells.
He appears as an impossibly large glittering black dragon, so huge and oppressive his scales might be mistaken for the night sky.
He needs no allies and considers all the other deities as inferiors to be plotted against for now and destroyed later.
Noi Tai Darastrix is known as the King of All Wyrms and this title includes all of dragonkind such as the drakes and wyverns.
When the world was young, Noi Tai Darastrix traveled throughout the lands raping young dragons that he deemed worthy.
He would then strike those lands with his massive claws so that the other deities would know he and his offspring had laid claim to that place.
The continent of Kara-Tur bears his mark south of Attillan, known as the Dragonskar, near Redgorge and Cauldera.

deity.name: Pantero nelde'Arda
deity.title: God of the elves and Di'rak

customProperties.Domains: {@class cleric|phb|Liberation|Liberation Domain}, {@class cleric|phb|Protection|Protection Domain}, {@class cleric|phb|War|War Domain}
customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Elves, Di'rak, Magic, Arts and Crafts, Music, Poetry, War
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Elves, Half-elves, Rangers, Artists, Poets, Lovers

entries: The deity of the elves and di'rak, Pantero nelde'Arda, usually appears as an ancient, yet powerful, male cat-like elf armed with a longbow.
He also wears a belt displaying his cat-head symbol.
He has a lithe and swift look about him, and his movements are swift and graceful; or he can be almost indistinguishable from the forest around him and as un-moving as the largest tree.
Despite Pantero being the creator and protector of both the elven and di'rak races, many elves do not accept the unrefined di'rak as kinsmen.

deity.name: Ranos'Mai Styx
deity.title: God of secrets

customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Wizards, Sorcerers, Conspirators, Thieves, Assassins, Murderers, Spies

entries: Ranos'Mai, deity of secrets, was once a mortal king who became a lich.
Nothing more is known of his past before he ascended into godhood.
His followers go to great lengths to keep the details of his ascension a secret.
Some believe that if the origin of the god became known, the god himself would become undone.
He usually appears as a pale-skinned human with black hair, red eyes with blue or black armor and a red four-sided gem set in his forehead and/or chest.

deity.name: Rayven Mestes
deity.title: Demigod of Nature

customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Forests, Woodlands, Flora and Fauna, Love, Purity
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Elves, Half-Elves, Rangers, Druids, Sailors, Hunters, Farmers, Woodsmen, Tradesmen

entries: Rayven sometimes appears as a human and sometimes as an elf; in either form she appears powerful and has long black hair.

Her garb varies, ranging from the serviceable clothing of a forester or ranger armed with a hunting spear, to the delicate gown of an elven princess, to a set of full-plate with her greatsword, but it is always white and blue.
Rayven watches over all good people who live, love or make their livelihood from the forest or the sea.
She is married to Ambro Eurix and their love remains strong despite that their duties keep them apart, sometimes for decades.

deity.name: Ruman'Ahk
deity.title: Demigod of death
entries: The deity of death, Ruman'Ahk, is widely known and widely feared.
He appears as a powerful man with a bestial head resembling a donkey, with a curved snout and upright, square-tipped ears.
He also has a long, forked tail. His black staff generates a scythe-like blade of red energy that slays anyone it touches.

deity.name: Sakata Ganymos
deity.title: God of the Bushido Code

customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Valor, Chivalry, Justice, Honor, War, Daring, Discipline
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: {@class fighter|phb|Samurai}, {@class paladin|phb|paladins}, {@class fighter|phb|Fighters}, {@class monk|phb|Monks}, Judges, Constables

entries: The creator of the Bushido Code, Sakata Ganymos appears as a tall human male with tan skin and green hair.
He wears an exquisite Ō-yoroi and carries a katana.
He wages war against chaos of all sorts, especially against his brother and nemesis, {@deity Ranos'Mai Styx|Claybough|DeitiesClaybough|Ranos'Mai Styx}.

deity.name: Taiia
deity.title: Goddess of the sun

customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Rulers, Viziers, {@class fighter|phb|Fighters}, {@class paladin|phb|Paladins}, {@class monk|phb|Monks}, {@class bard|phb|Bards}, {@class ranger|phb|Rangers}, {@class druid|phb|Druids}, Healers, Commoners

entries: The deity of the sun appears as a humanoid of indeterminate race, with red or bronze skin, golden hair and (usually) four arms.
She is surrounded with a nimbus of bright light, and no darkness can tolerate her presence.
A supporter of those in need, and an adversary of all that is evil, she is worshiped in almost all civilized lands and her priests are well-received wherever they go.

deity.name: Toldoth
deity.title: Goddess of the living and the Mother of the Deformed

customProperties.Domains: Chaos, Evil, {@class cleric|phb|Death|Death Domain|dmg}, {@class cleric|phb|Destruction|Destruction Domain}, {@class cleric|phb|Madness|Madness Domain}, {@class cleric|phb|War|War Domain}
customProperties.Form of Worship and Holidays: Negative Energy, Darkness, Destruction, Orcs, War, Hate, Envy, Malice, Panic, Ugliness, Slaughter
customProperties.Typical Worshipers: Undead, Gnolls, Medusas, Harpies, Goblins, Minotaurs, Hidden Human Cults, the Insane, Bugbears, Derros, Lamiaa, Morlocks, Ogres

entries: The enemy of the living and the Mother of the Deformed, Toldoth is a dark creature composed of negative energy.
She usually appears as a nightshade or a wraith.
Most followers of Toldoth are monsters, many are undead and few are humanoids, although hidden cults of Toldoth exist throughout many civilized societies.
